titles.title: Tamarisk Research and Control Act of 2003

To authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to make a grant to support research to develop enhanced methods for the long-term control and suppression of the invasive plant species tamarisk in the Colorado River watershed in western Colorado and eastern Utah.

bill.summary: 2/11/2003--Introduced. Tamarisk Research and Control Act of 2003 - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture, through the Cooperative State Research, Education and Extension Service, to make a grant to Mesa State College of Grand Junction, Colorado, for research and extension efforts to promote long-term control of the invasive tamarisk plant species, and revegetation of reclaimed areas, in the Colorado River watershed in Colorado and Utah.
